intro: Papaver nudum, commonly known as the meadow poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a distinctive black spot at the base. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and erect. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to the landscape.
